name: Far Niente
bio: Napa Valley Estate with a history dating back to 1885, crafting signature style, world-class Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon | 21+

social_posts.post_text:
Celebrate your favorite holidays with an unmatched and highly regarded late-harvest wine. We are honored to share that Dolce has recently been awarded 94 points by James Suckling.

He writes, "An alluring nose of red apples, sliced pears, grated nutmeg, and honeycomb. Medium-bodied with dense texture and lush sweetness. Complex on the palate with a nutty character and notes of ground spice adding depth to the baked fruits and warm citrus. Long and steady. Drink or hold."

Link in bio.

Crafting Dolce, our late-harvest wine, involves the finest craftsmanship and the willingness of Mother Nature to lend a hand. Dolce requires the action of botrytis, a ubiquitous mold that, when growing at the right stage of berry development, is known as “noble rot”. It degrades and perforates the grape skin, allowing for the dehydration and concentration of flavors and sugars.

It can take our specialized team 6 to 10 harvest passes to meticulously comb through our vineyard and pick the right clusters. Even after the individual assessments, the fruit is reexamined to ultimately decide if it goes to the winery.
At the winery, the fruit is divided into small batches for fermentation. This could result in 10 to 20 lots of wine from which the best is blended into the luxurious liquid gold that we know as Dolce.

Dolce Winemaker, Greg Allen, and his team’s dedication to this one-of-a-kind internationally acclaimed wine culminates in an intensely concentrated, richly unctuous, luscious sweetness that makes such painstaking effort more than worth it.
Sharing our well wishes for a cherished weekend spent with family as well as our gratitude for welcoming our wine into your homes this holiday season.

Our shipping cutoffs may have closed, but you can still give the ultimate Napa Valley experience with a wine club membership.

Choose to gift in two or four shipments or as an ongoing membership and share the wines, perks, and event experiences with them. We'll send a card letting your recipient know what fun is in store.  Link in bio.

"Thank you for inviting us into your homes and lives this year! The knowledge that our wines might have a place in your grandest occasions (and your everyday moments) will continue to inspire us into the new year!" Beth Nickel, Far Niente Foundress

"As we close the year, I am beyond thrilled with the quality of fruit from our Napa Valley vineyards and our Martin Stelling Vineyard in Oakville was a standout, giving us concentration, beautiful color, and ripe tannins that will transform into something truly special as it evolves.  Wishing you a joyous holiday from all of us at Far Niente!" - Nicole Marchesi, Far Niente Winemaker

We're adding the finishing touches to 2022 as we prepare to usher in a bright new year. We wish you a sweet beginning to 2023 with Dolce.

📸: @districtofchic
A new year has dawned and we're greeting 2023 with passion and precision.

A classic for a reason. Our team strives to make each vintage of Far Niente Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon the best it can be, while maintaining consistency from year to year in order to ensure that each bottle you select tastes like the wine you know and love.

The Martin Stelling Vineyard, where these grapes are sourced, is the cornerstone of Far Niente Cabernet Sauvignon. Planted on some of the most beautiful, gravelly loam soil in the Napa Valley, the vineyard uniformly produces wines with supple tannins, bright, forward fruit, and a beautiful tannin structure.

We've ushered in the new year with an added focus on our new Library Tasting Experience. In Chelsea Davis's latest piece for @Forbes she writes, "The new Library Tasting will take guests on a multi-sensory experience as they explore Far Niente’s stunning estate and taste its award-winning wines. Guests first explore the property's wine caves, before making their way to the historic winery for a curated food and wine pairing."

Chef Phillip Moratin weighs in, "Instead of pairing the wines to the food I’ve reversed the order to let the wines be the heroes, highlighting the amazing amount of work that the team puts into crafting them. I am working directly with the winemakers to learn about the wines and vintages so I can carefully adjust each dish to find the ideal match for the wines, accentuating their unique flavors and character." 

Learn more with the link in our bio.

Expertly crafted, this winter white is perfect to savor through every season with its unwavering quintessential Far Niente excellence. Bright and lively, the 2021 vintage opens with aromas of lemon zest, kumquat, toasted almonds, a hint of wet stone and flint, and light fresh-cut herbs. This wine immediately enchants with a silky entry and vibrant flavors of grilled citrus, light green melon, and toasted oak that expand across the mid-palate all the way until the finish. This wine's versatility allows it to be enjoyed now or to be cellared for a special occasion.

Far Niente was established in Oakville, CA in 1885, prospering until the onset of Prohibition in 1919, when the winery ceased operation and the estate was abandoned. Sixty years later, in 1979, the winery underwent a three-year renovation, which restored the building to its original, 19th-century grandeur with winemaking once again returning to Far Niente. Four decades later, we remain focused on crafting exceptional Chardonnay and Cabernet with the same tenacity.

“Our chardonnay vineyards are planted in Napa Valley’s southernmost regions, where they enjoy a cool, maritime-influenced climate ideal for ripening this noblest of white wines. From the elegant perfume to the full, round flavors and lifted acidity, I want to taste the essence of our vineyards—and to capture the pure, natural beauty of our fruit—in every bottle of Far Niente Chardonnay.” -Nicole Marchesi, Far Niente Winemaker

The eye-catching golden hue of mustard that blankets the Napa Valley this time of year, signals the start of the growing season! It serves as a beneficial vineyard cover crop preventing soil erosion and replenishing nutrients.

Few things in life say "I love you" better than a bottle of wine that is as timeless as the love you share. Shop our etched bottles and Valentine's Day gifts at the link in bio. Order by midnight today for gifts to arrive by Valentine's Day with 2-day air.

Premiere Napa Valley is the most important week in the Napa Valley wine business with the 2021 vintage making its debut! Described as “pure joy”, the 2021 growing season is known for low yields, intensely flavored fruit and a smooth harvest season. Wine trade from around the world will bid on their favorite auction lots on Saturday, February 25th.

Our estate bottled, Premiere auction lot wine offering comes from lot no. 39 of our original estate vineyard and the backbone of Far Niente Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon, the Martin Stelling Vineyard. @premierenapa

First, we feed the soil.
Cover crops return nitrogen from the air back into the soils—a vital process that increases vineyard fertility. Here at our Carneros Vineyard, the cover crops are transforming the soils into rich, complex growing mediums, where our grapes can flourish.

As a token of our gratitude and appreciation for your generosity during Giving Tuesday, Far Niente Wine Estates donated $15,000 to The V Foundation.
 
As a long-time partner of The V Foundation, we are proud to continue our support for this life-changing organization to help people around the world accelerate victory over cancer. 
 
Visit the link in our bio to learn more.

From @Forbes, our 2021 Far Niente Napa Valley Chardonnay is one of the best “10 Ways to Say Yay to Chardonnay”. 

Here’s an excerpt from the article by author Lana Bortolot: 
“From an illustrious producer, this lighter style of Chardonnay uses grapes from multi parcels in the Coombsville sub appellation, a slightly cooler, but well protected climate zone. The resulting wine expresses a more tropical interpretation of Chardonnay, with pineapple, guava and melon and keeps that high tone on the palate. There was no malolactic fermentation, keeping this on the tingly-zesty side of things, but the complexity for which Far Niente is known is unmistakable.”

Beyond a winery, the Far Niente Estate is a historic monument in the heart of Napa Valley. 

An architectural gem situated in the heart of Oakville, Far Niente’s Estate dates to 1885 when it was established by pioneer John Benson and listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

When you visit Napa, it’s an enchanting place you won’t want to miss. Book your visit at the link in bio.

Enter the Round Room.

When you visit our winery, stop by to take a peek into our crown jewel within the expansive labyrinth of caves deep beneath our estate. The Round Room’s unique acoustics will enchant you. Step into the center of the room and hear your voice fill the space.

To tour Far Niente’s historic Oakville estate, please make a reservation at the link in bio.

We are honored to be recognized by @WineEnthusiast for our 2019 Estate Bottled Oakville, Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon with a rating of 98 points, Cellar Selection. 

Silky on entry with flavors of blackberry and cocoa, this wine is beautifully textured with well-integrated tannins and a finish that is smooth and long-lasting.
 
Add to your cellar at the link in our bio.

Life emerges 🌱and Spring sprouts forth.
The season’s bud break has arrived as young shoots emerge from our Napa Valley Chardonnay grapevines at Berlenbach Vineyard. Our Cabernet Sauvignon vines are not far behind.

Did you know: Coombsville was designated as a Napa Valley sub-appellation in 2011.

Set among some of Southern California’s most colorful blooms, join Proprietress Beth Nickel, Dolce Winemaker Greg Allen, and members of the Far Niente Wine Estates team on Thursday, April 27, 2023 as we celebrate the natural and geographic diversity of some of our most captivating wines. Paired with an elegant menu designed to highlight our Napa and Russian River Valley selections, our second garden dinner of the year promises to captivate all the senses.
If you have never experienced Carlsbad’s exquisite Flower Fields you are in for a treat. This 50-acre jewel is only open from March 1 to Mother’s Day each year.
Limited tickets are available – reserve at the link in our bio.

Celebrating Easter Sunday, gathering for Passover, or enjoying a nice spring day with friends and family—open a bottle of our 2021 Far Niente Napa Valley Chardonnay. Take in the aromas of lemon zest and vibrant flavors of citrus that expand across the mid-palate all the way until the finish.

Discover more at the link in our bio.

We were delighted to participate in the 26th annual Taste of Oakville Grand Tasting! Hosted by @oakvillewinegrowers at Nickel & Nickel, this event is a celebration of some of the finest wines in the heart of Napa Valley.
Pictured is our Far Niente team, George MacDonald and Carrie Campbell, pouring our 2018 and 2019 vintages of the Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon, the highest expression of our Oakville Stelling vineyards.

Immaculate grounds.

The annual Best of Wine Tourism Awards have been announced, and we’re proud that our landscaping team has taken home the Best Architecture and Landscape award.

Our team keeps our 13 acres of gardens, home to 13,125 flowers beautiful all year long, but Spring showcases their work in full glory. We invite you to come see for yourself!

Known as Liquid Gold from Napa Valley, we are excited to share the 2016 Dolce with you. James Suckling awarded this vintage 97 points and described it as "a superb, sweet wine from America with "candied apples, pears, pineapple, and hints of spice…The real deal." 
Crafting Dolce is Winemaker Greg Allen's truest labor of love. He patiently waits for the perfect conditions in the vineyard, and then grapes are handpicked over several passes. Individual clusters, partial clusters, and even single berries are chosen. After fermentation, this wine slowly matures in 100% French oak barrels for nearly 3 years behind the locked Dolce gates.
Discover the 2016 Dolce at the link in our bio.

This Monday, our vineyard team headed out to the Stelling Vineyard at the Far Niente Estate in Oakville to continue the regeneration of specific vineyard blocks. 

The trellising work consists of creating an infrastructure of wires and posts to better support and direct the canopy of our grapevines to maximize exposure to sunlight. Ensuring our grapevines receive optimal sunlight helps promote vine health and optimize grape development for superb aromas and flavors in our wine.

This Monday, after aging nearly three years in new French oak and a selective blending process, the 2019 vintage Dolce finally made its journey into the bottle. Only the best lots make it into the master blend, which ultimately makes it into the bottle where it will age until release.

Happy #EarthDay 🌎 From water conservation to solar energy—and so much more—when it comes to sustainability at Far Niente, our Director of Vineyard Operations John McCarthy is one of our biggest champions.

Discover more by reading “Sustainability in our Vineyards and Wineries, an Earth Day Conversation with John McCarthy” on our blog. 

Read more at the link in our bio.

Since the 1980s, we've released a very limited annual allocation of Cave Collection Cabernet Sauvignons. Exclusive and exquisite, the Cave Collection is your chance to savor a beloved vintage.

Only getting more delicious with age, add to your cellar at the link in bio.
After patiently aging our 2021 Far Niente Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon in French oak for 17 months, we recently completed transferring it to the bottle where it will continue to age until release.

Just in: Our Far Niente 2021 Napa Valley Chardonnay has received a rating of 94 points with @WineEnthusiast!

Sourced from vineyards throughout Napa Valley, our Chardonnay reflects our signature style, enchanting the palate with a subtle tropical fruit flavor, complex aromas, and a richness like no other.

Bright and lively, it’s everything you want a Chardonnay to be and perfectly pairs with a warm spring day.

Join us June 2-3 for an incredible weekend of only-in-Napa Valley hospitality at Collective Napa Valley Together Again. Enjoy vintner-hosted dinners, an exciting live auction, and an exclusive first taste of the 2022 Far Niente Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon at the Napa Valley Barrel Auction.
Proceeds from the weekend’s festivities go toward funding the key to a bright future: the children of Napa Valley.
Limited tickets are available - reserve at the link in bio.

Step into an enchanting fairytale. 
Beaming with the vibrance of over 13,125 tulips in full bloom and 13 acres of captivating gardens, your spring escape awaits you at Far Niente.
Reserve your next visit at the link in our bio.

To the mothers that make Far Niente much more magical, and to all the mother figures who make life that much sweeter, Happy Mother's Day!

This year, we asked our amazing mother figures, whatever their title may be - step moms, new moms, and dog moms to share how they will be spending their special day.

Spring at Far Niente.
As the sunlight pours in, the stunning dogwoods and foxgloves on our Estate glisten in full glory.

The 2020 Far Niente Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon entices the nose with aromas of licorice, dark cherry, raspberry, warm spice, and savory herbal notes, enters with a silky-smooth texture supported by well-integrated tannins and a juicy, mouth-watering finish.

Discover more at the link in our bio.

As thousands of southern azaleas bloom, our Estate is blanketed with a gleaming hue of bright red and deep pink. Known to be the largest single planting of this particular variety of azalea in California, we invite you to visit Far Niente to experience spring in full swing.

Celebrate #ChardonnayDay with the 2021 Napa Valley Chardonnay.

“It just goes with so many things. It’s mouthwatering as a young wine, luscious when aged, pairs well with casual fare, can be dressed up for fine dining, and is a delightful aperitif all by itself.” —Nicole Marchesi, Far Niente Winemaker 

Be among the first to know about our Chardonnay Day offerings, new release wines & exclusive events - join our list at the link in our bio!

It’s an exciting time to be at Stelling Vineyard.

John McCarthy, our Director of Vineyard Operations, agrees, saying: “Now that the season has started and the temperatures are warming up, we are starting to see flowering and fruit set in the vineyards! The warm weather is cooperating to allow the vine’s perfect flower to self-pollinate and form beautiful clusters of grapes.”

Something new to see every day.

Dreaming of summer? Escape to Napa Valley. We’re opening our Estates after hours for our popular Friday Night Series where we'll be sharing exclusive releases with perfectly paired small bites.

Tickets are now available at the link in our bio.

The best of Napa Valley awaits. Visit our Oakville Estate to indulge in some of Napa Valley’s most exquisite wines. While you’re here, immerse yourself in our lush, enchanting gardens that reflect a distinctive southern style.

Book your visit today at the link in our bio.

From showing up for the ones you love to empowering those you work with, we raise our glass to the father figures who've made us who we are.

We asked the dads who seem to do it all at Far Niente how they will be celebrating their special day.

Here’s to those who made this year's Cabernet Weekend one to remember. It was our pleasure to treat our Wine Club Members to an intimate vineyard weekend, a delicious four-course Library Dinner, and tastings of Far Niente Cabernet vintages from our library.

Become a member to be among the first to hear about exclusive events at our winery.

109 years after the founding of our country, we proudly founded our winery in 1885. Today, we are listed on the “National Register of Historic Places”, a testament to our winery’s rich history. Happy Fourth of July.

Dolce Winemaker, Greg Allen recently hosted a media event in New York City where he shared the versatility and elegance of our internationally acclaimed, Dolce Late Harvest Wine. He presented a flight of remarkable vintages including the 2008 so guests could experience firsthand the age-worthiness of Dolce. Paired with a menu including Truffle Ricotta Ravioli and a variety of hand-selected cheeses, Greg highlighted the versatility of Dolce and how each vintage’s unique qualities can be savored with perfect flavors.
 
Greg shared the trials, precision, and heart that goes into making each vintage earning it the title of Greg’s “truest labor of love”.

An enchanting evening is in store. Our sister winery, the Nickel & Nickel Winery, is hosting the 2023 Festival Napa Valley’s Arts for All Gala. At this amazing event, guests will delight in the exquisite wines of Far Niente and Nickel & Nickel, a dinner prepared by Michelin-Star Chef Charlie Palmer, and the live music of Country Superstar Carrie Underwood—all to raise money for a great cause.

Our Cave Collection Chardonnays are truly something special.

As time goes on, they only get better with age. What starts off as delightfully fruit-forward and brightly acidic, elegantly evolves into a sophisticated, creamy, and rich wine over time. 

Exclusive and exquisite, our age-worthy Cave Collection Chardonnays are available on an extremely limited basis.

Add to your cellar at the link in bio.

Summer is an exciting time to be in the cellar at Far Niente. Winemaker Nicole Marchesi is ready to bottle our vintage 2022 Napa Valley Chardonnay.  After harvest, each vineyard block is kept separate while aging in barrel until the wine is ready and she can begin crafting our signature house style.  The result is a Chardonnay that elegantly expresses the beautiful nuances of several pedigreed vineyards.

The 2022 vintage will soon be yours to enjoy!

We're honored to continue our longstanding partnership with the V Foundation at the 25th annual @vfwcelebration this weekend. 

For over 20 years, Far Niente Proprietress Beth Nickel has made it her mission to support cancer research through the V Foundation in memory of her beloved late husband, Gil, who battled melanoma.

We are excited to share that Beth will be honored at this year's celebration with the first-ever humanitarian award, thanking her for her decades of support and incredible work. 

We look forward to raising a glass to Beth, the V Foundation, and all of the amazing support partnering in such an important cause.
A world of excellence awaits. Far Niente Insiders receive exclusive access to events, wines, and firsthand knowledge from our expert team. Become one by using the link in bio.

Add another high note to your summer to remember. Join us at Far Niente's Cabernet Grill for an evening of delicious lobster (with all the lobster-feed fixings), an excellent selection of Far Niente’s white wines, and fantastic live music. This is an event you won’t want to miss. August 25 only — book your visit now.

Tickets for Lobster & Chardonnay with Far Niente are available in limited quantities. Purchase yours today at our link in bio.
This summer, bask in the excellence of Far Niente with others. Pour your guests one of our meticulously crafted Napa Valley wines, and be transported to our enchanting estate with each luxurious sip.

Color-changing on the vines at Far Niente in Oakville.

Behold veraison—the stage in the growing process when the grapes begin to soften and change color on the vine, indicating the onset of ripening. Veraison is usually the marker of 60-70 days to harvest. Currently at our Martin Stelling Vineyard, our Cabernet Sauvignon grapes are in the homestretch of this spectacular growing season.

Congratulations to Beth Nickel, recipient of the V Foundation Inaugural Humanitarian of the Year Award. 

To honor our founder, Gil Nickel, Far Niente Wine Estates and Beth Nickel have donated over $10M to the V Foundation over twenty years.  From hosting the Annual Wine Country Gala Auction at Nickel & Nickel Winery to donating $1 million dollars to support The V Foundation- Gil Nickel Fellowship in Melanoma Research, here’s to all the progress we’ve made and the progress we’ll continue to make to achieve Victory Over Cancer®.
 
“We’re just one miracle away from having everything just right.” - Gil Nickel, Founder Far Niente Wine Estates

Watch the full video at the link in our bio.

It’s International Cabernet Sauvignon Day, and a great way to celebrate is by opening a bottle of our iconic Oakville, Napa Valley, Cabernet Sauvignon. For more than forty years, we have carefully honed our craft to develop a distinctive style that exudes eternal elegance. Our unwavering dedication to perfection has yielded impeccably crafted wines, offering an irresistible tapestry of flavors.

Discover more at the link in bio.

Step into a place full of wonder. Visit our Oakville Estate to savor some of Napa Valley’s most exquisite wines, and to marvel at enchanting gardens that reflect a distinctive southern style. Feel transported to another world as you sip and take in the breathtaking scenery.

Book your visit today at the link in bio.

Harvest has officially begun at Far Niente and with winemaking comes tradition. Every year, our team gathers at Far Niente Wine Estates to celebrate the start of each harvest with the blessing of the first grapes picked. 

We harvested the first blocks of our Berlenbach Vineyard in Coombsville at peak time to kick off this season’s exquisite vintage. This Chardonnay provides extraordinary characteristics, aromas, and flavors that will contribute to our 2023 Far Niente Napa Valley Chardonnay. We cannot wait for you to enjoy the fruits of our labor.

We’re honored that our charming estate was featured in @voguemagazine’s latest article, “A Guide to Napa Valley, California Wine Country’s Crown Jewel”. 

We are proud to be mentioned alongside fellow legacy wineries as being one of the “historic wineries worth adding to a newcomer’s guide to understanding the Napa wine scene.” Thank you, Vogue!

Visit our historic Oakville estate – book your experience today at the link in bio

Harvest season at our Martin Stelling Vineyard is truly the most enchanting time of year. Stretching into the western Oakville foothills just behind our Far Niente estate, the vineyard sits on an alluvial fan with well-drained soils that consistently reward us with beautifully balanced Cabernet Sauvignon. Surrounded by the beauty of the Napa Valley, it’s a privilege to experience each day, and it’s something we never take for granted.

It only takes a sip of our 2021 Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon to understand why the Tasting Panel awarded it 99 points. 

Upon entry, it captivates the palate with plush and velvety mixed-berry flavors that are supported by firm tannins. What follows is a long, juicy finish that is almost saccharine with trailing notes of caramelized sugar. A truly rich and full Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon from the exceptional 2021 vintage that beautifully captures the sense of place. 

Collect the finest of Napa Valley at the link in bio.

This holiday season, give the gift of Napa Valley’s finest. Become a Far Niente Insider for exclusive access to enchanting gifts for the wine lover in your life. Join our mailing list at the link in bio.

The newest release of our most iconic Chardonnay is here. Our 2022 Napa Valley Chardonnay beautifully captures why there’s nothing quite like Far Niente’s signature style. Masterfully blending outstanding Carneros and Coombsville vineyards results in our Chardonnay’s subtle tropical flavors, complex aromas, and uncommon richness that enchant in a way that only a Far Niente wine can. 

Elevate your cellar using our link in bio.

Today marks the 20th anniversary of the passing of our beloved founder, Gil Nickel. Gil was passionate about wine, race car driving, and living life to its fullest. He brought innovation, hard work, and humor to Far Niente and his legacy endures, having left an indelible impression that inspires us to this day.
Gil was truly a visionary of the Napa Valley wine industry driven by his passion to craft world-class wine. In 1979, he and his wife Beth embarked on a journey to meticulously restore the historic Far Niente Winery in Oakville, dating back to 1885, which would later earn its place on the National Register of Historic Places.
Gil’s legacy lives on through more than wine. Once a year, the V Foundation for Cancer Research organizes a wine celebration event that honors Gil’s memory and raises money for cancer research. And it is in his memory that Far Niente continues to support much-needed cancer research through the V Foundation.
We remember Gil today and every day for his ideas, witty jokes, dedication to winemaking and for the love he gave to his family.

The 2019 Far Niente Oakville Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon, placed #7 on the Wine Enthusiast Top 100 Cellar Selections with a 98 point score. Imbued with Far Niente’s distinctive house style, this critically acclaimed vintage opens strong with silky blackberry and cocoa flavors and captivates all the way through to the finish.

Add to your collection at the link in bio.

Celebrate the season with the gift of Napa Valley at its finest. The Far Niente Holiday Gift Shop has exquisite selection of gifts for all the wine lovers in your life. 

Shop our collections at our link in bio.

We have a lot to be thankful for. 

After all this time, we’re still crafting world-class Napa Valley wines that—through our signature style—enchant the palate like nothing else. And this is all made possible thanks to the incredible people that we’re beyond lucky to work with.�

We wanted to hear what our team members were thankful for, and this is what they had to say.�
From everyone at Far Niente, we hope you have a wonderful Thanksgiving.
Napa Valley Estate with a history dating back to 1885, crafting signature style, world-class Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon | 21+
